skill.name: react-component
skill.description:
Use when creating UI components in React - functional components, hooks, custom hooks, or component composition patterns.
NOT when backend logic, API routes, or non-React frameworks are involved.
Triggers: "create component", "build widget", "KPI card", "form", "modal", "custom hook", "useContext", "useState", "useEffect".

skill.author: Awais68

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance. No executable code, no network calls, no file system access, no environment variable access. This skill provides React best practices and patterns for AI assistants.

content.value_statement: Create React functional components and hooks with TypeScript. This skill provides patterns for building accessible, performant, and maintainable UI components following modern React best practices.
actual_capabilities: Create functional React components with TypeScript props interfaces
Build custom hooks with proper state management and cleanup
Implement component composition patterns using children and render props
Apply React.memo, useCallback, and useMemo for performance optimization
Handle loading states, error states, and accessibility requirements
Generate unit tests and Storybook stories for components
limitations: Does not generate backend API routes or server-side code
Does not configure build tools or bundlers
Does not install dependencies or modify package.json
Focused on React only; other frameworks not covered

use_cases.title: Build UI widgets and KPI cards
use_cases.description: Create reusable KPI cards, data tables, and dashboard widgets for enterprise applications

use_cases.title: Extract reusable custom hooks
use_cases.description: Refactor component logic into custom hooks with proper typing and error handling

use_cases.title: Build form components with validation
use_cases.description: Create form components with TypeScript, validation, and accessible error states

prompt_templates.title: Create simple component
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a React functional component called StudentKPICard that displays a student's name and attendance percentage. Use TypeScript and include a loading state.

prompt_templates.title: Build custom hook
prompt_templates.prompt: Build a custom hook called useAttendance that fetches student attendance data. Include loading state, error handling, and a refetch function.

prompt_templates.title: Component with composition
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a reusable Card component using composition patterns. It should accept a title, children content, and optional footer. Use TypeScript.

prompt_templates.title: Form with validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a StudentForm component using React Hook Form. Include name and email fields with required validation and error display.

output_examples.input: Create a button component with loading state
output: ✓ Component file: Button.tsx with typed props interface

best_practices: Always use functional components with explicit TypeScript props interfaces
Include cleanup functions in useEffect to prevent memory leaks
Apply React.memo and useCallback for components receiving same props frequently
Ensure accessibility with proper ARIA labels and keyboard navigation support
anti_patterns: Avoid using class components; use functional components with hooks instead
Do not use any types; always define explicit TypeScript interfaces
Avoid hardcoded text; prepare components for internationalization
Do not skip error handling or loading states for async operations

faq.question: What React version does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports React 18 and 19+ with modern hooks patterns and latest TypeScript best practices.

faq.question: Does this skill create test files?
faq.answer: Yes, it generates Jest/Vitest test files and Storybook stories for each component.

faq.question: Can I use this with Next.js?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns work with Next.js App Router and Pages Router components.

faq.question: Is data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt skill with no data storage, transmission, or external calls.

faq.question: Does this work with shadcn/ui components?
faq.answer: Yes, it integrates shadcn/ui patterns and uses their component conventions.

faq.question: How does this compare to generic code generation?
faq.answer: Provides React-specific patterns, TypeScript typing, accessibility, and testing built-in.
